pages.body:
## Comparison of Decentralized Social Media

This was supposed to be a table:

| Name                      | reward - Author | reward - Curator * | Anonymity | Group | Edit/Delete posts ** | Notes |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |------------------ |
|............................... |.......................................|  ........................................|  ..................|  ..........|   ..........|  
|* sapien.network * | ​Yes      | No            | Phone verification is needed for monetization | Yes | | No sustainable monetary model |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| *Hive* | Yes | Yes | Yes | | | 7 days time-limit for receiving like (Not attractive policy for amateurs, also encourage posting more frequently which decrease quality) |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| *D-tube* | Yes | Yes | Yes | | | only for videos |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| ZeroNet (ZeroMe) | No | No | Yes | No | | Running nodes does not require a lot of resources, users act as node automatically |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| Sub-social | Yes | No | Yes | Yes | | No reward for non-professionals only those who can sell ad slot would be rewarded |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| facebook | No | No | force face verification for Tor users account creation even on onion site | | | Not decentralized, mentioned  only for comparison |
| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |:------------------:| ------------------ |
| Twitter  | No | No | force phone call for Tor users account creation | | | Not decentralized, mentioned  only for comparison |

* Curator reward is needed for some posts disclosing new content (e.g. political or critical) in some countries (for example for first 100 persons upvote the post) because there would be a fear if only a few be aware of something, that for example they would e added to the government kill list. That reward compensate that fear

** Not allowing to delete, is usable if you need for example an immutable archive. Although all blochchain based d-app's data technically considered immutable
